meanings.definition: The quality of being favorable to or promoting health or well-being.
meanings.sent1: The salubrity of the fresh air in the mountains made me feel invigorated.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended spending time in nature to improve the salubrity of my lungs.
meanings.sent3: The salubrity of the salad was so impressive that it seemed to sparkle with healthiness.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a salubrity that could brighten even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The salubrity of the clear, cool water was a refreshing oasis in the desert.

meanings.definition: The state of being salubrious; healthfulness.
meanings.sent1: We enjoyed the salubrity of the coastal breeze during our vacation.
meanings.sent2: The salubrity of the organic fruits and vegetables was evident in their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The salubrity of the gym was so contagious that even the lazy felt motivated to exercise.
meanings.sent4: His laughter filled the room with a salubrity that lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The salubrity of her positive attitude was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
